channel.title: Setting classpaths in Ubuntu 8.10
channel.description: I've been trying to set my classpaths on Ubuntu for the past month now, i still can't seem to figure it out. I've removed all my Java stuff from the package manager, and installed Suns own Java and now it's saying i haven't got Java at all. Is this because the folders are on my desktop, should they be somewhere else? Any help will be greatly appreciated :cool:.

item.title: Setting classpaths in Ubuntu 8.10
item.dc:creator: @Tulitikku Tulitikku
item.description:
@Tulitikku wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:7, topic:268814”][quote author=Tulitikku link=topic=354707.msg2717602#msg2717602 date=1237741384]

I could have sworn JRE and JDK auto set classpaths upon install.
[/quote]I thought so too, and a lot of the threads I’ve come across told that as well.
But no, i tried the guide he sent and I only got the Firefox Java plugin to work.
This is what I got when I try to run a normal RSPS client:

Loading client.. Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: sign/signlink at Gui.<init>(Gui.java:51) at Gui.main(Gui.java:40) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: sign.signlink at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) ... 2 more
It seems it at least tries to run the client, since there is a few second delay when i type in java Gui.

That isn’t a classpath error…

I actually giggled.

So did I.[/quote]Then I guess the guide that was posted worked, and I have the classpaths set.
EDIT: I got it to work, thanks a bunch guys. (Even tho most of you just laughed ;))

Read full topic

item.title: Setting classpaths in Ubuntu 8.10
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:8, topic:268814”][quote author=Tulitikku link=topic=354707.msg2717602#msg2717602 date=1237741384]

I could have sworn JRE and JDK auto set classpaths upon install.
[/quote]I thought so too, and a lot of the threads I’ve come across told that as well.
But no, i tried the guide he sent and I only got the Firefox Java plugin to work.
This is what I got when I try to run a normal RSPS client:

Loading client.. Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: sign/signlink at Gui.<init>(Gui.java:51) at Gui.main(Gui.java:40) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: sign.signlink at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) ... 2 more
It seems it at least tries to run the client, since there is a few second delay when i type in java Gui.

it means your missing a class

I actually giggled.

me2[/quote]

or he hasn’t set the directory right.

Read full topic
